wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Clark (4 July 1834 – 4 July 1926) was an English oil painter, well known in the Victorian era for his domestic scenes, especially of children.

response: *Joseph Clark (1834–1926), painter, was born in Cerne Abbas
* Joseph Clark  (1834–1926), English oil painter of domestic scenes
*Joseph Clark (painter) (1834–1926), English painter in oils known for domestic scenes
*Joseph Clark (New York politician) (1787–1873), New York politician

Clark was a nephew of the painter and illustrator Joseph Clark (1834–1926), who was also a native of Cerne Abbas."Clark, Joseph, (4 July 1834–4 July 1926)", in Who Was Who 1916–1928 (1992 reprint, ): "Member of Institute of Oil Painters, Born Cerne Abbas, Dorsetshire, 4 July 1834; m 1868, d of John Jones, Winchester; one s three d; died 4 July 1926" The younger Clark later lived with his uncle in Holloway, London, Joseph Benwell Clark (1857–1938), Artist, npg.org.uk, accessed 18 October 2020 while studying art at the Slade School of Fine Art, under Alphonse Legros, whose best pupil he was.Joseph Benwell Clark at britishmuseum.org, accessed 3 October 2020 He thus got to know William Strang, another pupil,"STRANG, WILLIAM (1850– )", in Encyclopædia Britannica, Vol. 25 (1911), text online at Wikisource and they and Charles Holroyd are the three of Legros's students mentioned in Arthur M. Hind's A History of Engraving and Etching.Arthur Mayger Hind, A History of Engraving and Etching from the fifteenth century to the year 1914 (Courier, new impression, 2011), p. 387 While he was at the Slade, Clark also became a friend of Henry Scott Tuke and the writer Samuel Butler.Peter Raby, Samuel Butler: A Biography (1991), p. 108
